author: Trevor Smith
title: Juvenile & Young Thug - Red Sox
text:
0 MAKE IT STOP Juvenile and Young Thug unite for "Red Sox." 
Juvenile could easily retire right now and still be remembered as a rap legend. Instead, he's preparing to release the "modern day 400 Degreez, " according to the SoundCloud description of his new track "Red Sox." For those who may be too young to remember, 400 Degreez is the 1998 album from Juvie that housed the massive single "Back That Azz Up' and "Ha," and was certified 4x platinum a year after its release.Setting a goal to replicate that kind of influence is ambitious, but Juvie has teamed with the right person to get the album rollout started, tapping Young Thug for the new record. Juvie starts things off with his signature bounce flows, before handing things off to Thug who pays tribute to the H-O-T Boys, Juvenile's former group, and takes the track in some unexpected directions. Quotable Lyrics: I knew my mother very wellI ain't know my dadCamouflage rags up in the airGot some soldiers over hereSoldiers over there
